nycTheatreExcerpt: Peter Morgan, like a moth to the flame of spirited stateliness, can be relied upon to provide dramatized look behind diplomatic doors in one of two modes: dignified (The Queen, The Audience, the first few seasons of The Crown) and haute-trashy (The Other Boleyn Girl, the last few seasons of The Crown). In Patriots, his latest play, now in performance at the Barrymore Theatre after a London run last year, he's drawn to the fire of narcissistic politicos but burned by the frost of his unclear intentions...The problem is, dramatically, he has nowhere to go, and neither do we.
